definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: The basic functions of the head-box of papermachine are described in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文描述了造纸机流浆箱的基本功能。

sentences.english: Our company produce a lot of specifications Bamboo, for crafts, papermaking, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 我厂大量生产中规格竹片，可作工艺品，造纸等。

sentences.english: Web: A continuous rol of paper formed on a papermaking machine. Also called Reel.
sentences.chinese: 该工艺用来造纸，目前也用来制作纤维网。

sentences.english: As to make paper, paper and printed books.
sentences.chinese: 不如送去造纸，造出纸来又可以印书。

sentences.english: There is necessity and possibility to accelerate the exploitation of quick-growing trees for papermaking.
sentences.chinese: 加速开发速生材造纸，既有必要，也有可能。

sentences.english: Founded in 2005 mainly produces a full set of papermaking equipment.
sentences.chinese: 公司成立于2005年主要生产全套造纸设备。

sentences.english: For Paper-making machines as well as for staining cloth from filter-presses, the above mentioned mis-performance can have negative results.
sentences.chinese: 对于造纸机以及压滤机滤布，以上装置存在明显缺陷。

sentences.english: In paper manufacture the lip gap at the headbox determines the thickness of the paper.
sentences.chinese: 造纸工业中，流浆箱的出口边沿间隙决定纸张的厚度。

sentences.english: He added that Printing and Papermaking Skill were closely related with Silk.
sentences.chinese: 赵丰还说，印刷造纸术与丝绸紧密相关。

sentences.english: My father is a cleaner at a local paper mill.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲是本地一家造纸厂的清洁工。

sentences.english: The design of the vacuum system is important component part of the engineering design of the paper machine.
sentences.chinese: 真空系统设计是造纸机工程设计的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Papermaking began in China and from here it spread to North Africa and Europe.
sentences.chinese: 造纸术开始于中国，随后传入北非和欧洲。

sentences.english: He paints Xuzi, a friend who has been laid off by the paper mill.
sentences.chinese: “徐子”，则描绘了一个被造纸厂解雇的朋友。

sentences.english: The pollution of pulping and papermaking industry has caused serious destroy on environment.
sentences.chinese: 制浆造纸工业废水对环境造成了严重污染。

sentences.english: Paper-milling is now a dead industry there.
sentences.chinese: 那里的造纸业现在是一片死气沉沉。

sentences.english: Some problems are especially introduced to involve our paper industry developments.
sentences.chinese: 文中特别介绍了涉及我国造纸工业发展的一些问题。

definition: chemical industry, abbr. of 化學工業|化学工业[hua4 xue2 gong1 ye4]/chemical engineering, abbr. of 化學工程|化学工程[hua4 xue2 gong1 cheng2]
coking/the process of producing coke from coal
non-ferrous metals (all metals excluding iron, chromium, manganese and their alloys)
